#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=At least twelve die in Mogadishu attacks
#Text=Saturday , January 30 , 2010
#Text=Map showing location of Mogadishu in Somalia
#Text=Early on Friday , Islamic insurgents fought with African peace-keepers and the Somali army in Mogadishu , capital of Somalia , killing twelve people .
#Text=The battle raged on for hours , according to sources .
#Text=The al-Shabaab group claimed responsibility for the attack .
#Text=Twelve civilians were killed in the incident , while 25 were injured .
#Text=The Hodan Wardhigley and Howl Wadag districts were the worst hit .
#Text=Medical authorities claimed that the deaths had occurred when mortar fire had burnt their houses .
#Text=The fire came from both the insurgents and the peace-keepers , according to the officials .
#Text=Ali Musa , one of the officials of a volunteer ambulance service in Mogadishu , said that a mother and her two children had died during the firing .
#Text=The attack commenced on 2 AM , Friday .
#Text=Awakened by mortar explosions , residents hid inside their houses , while others left for safer places .
#Text=The battle went on for hours and the sound of the firing emanated to all parts of the Somali capital .
#Text=This was the most intense fighting in months , claim residents .
#Text=" I thought I was dreaming when I heard the sound of the artillery , " said Asha Abdulle , Mogadishu resident , while Ahmed Hashi said that the fighting was the " worst in months . "
#Text=Nurta Hussein , another resident said : " We were woken up by the explosions at 2 a.m. and have n't slept since because of the non-stop shelling .

#Text=However Somali officials called the attack  small and careless . "

column1: #Text=Mogadishu 's " Kilometer Four " area was one of those affected .
#Text=It includes a square that connects the airport to the port .
#Text=While the area has been attacked several times previously , this attack is said to be the worst .
#Text=African Union peace-keepers from Uganda are posted there .
#Text=The fighting comes almost a year since Sheikh Sharif Sheikh Ahmed was sworn in as the nation 's new president .
#Text=Al-Shabaab is considered a terrorist body by the United States ; the latter blames it for multiple attacks , shootings and bombings inside Somalia .
#Text=Al-Shabaab has also threatened other African countries , including Ethiopia , Djibouti , Kenya , Eritrea , Ghana , Sudan and Uganda .
#Text=An African Union soldier , on a condition of anonymity , said that one Ugandan soldier was killed in the clash .
#Text=He added that another soldier was wounded .
#Text=A Somali government official backed this claim .
#Text=Earlier , on Monday , two AU soldiers had died in another mortar attack in an AU clinic .

#Text=When contacted through telephone , Somalia 's Defence Minister , Sheikh Yusuf Mohammad Siad , who is a former warlord ( also known as " Inda'ade " or " white eyed " ) said more than ten insurgents had died in the clash .
#Text=Parts of the Shabaab group have connections with al-Qaeda .
#Text=The former has regularly attacked different parts of Somalia , with suicide bombers and several insurgents , taking advantage of the weak political and military infrastructure of the country .
#Text=The incident occurred exactly an year following President Sheikh Sharif Ahmed election to the parliament .
#Text=The government was set to celebrate its first anniversary with a parade and poetry recitations at the presidential palace , named Villa Somalia .
#Text=It was not known whether the attack intentionally collided with this event .
#Text=However , it was a reminder of Somalia 's weak military power ; the army was heavily dependent on the African troops in this attack as well .
#Text=For over two decades , the country has had no central government .
#Text=This has led to warlords ruling the nation , which often suffers from attacks by militant groups and pirate ships .

#Text=During an African Union ( AU ) summit Addis Ababa , capital of Ethiopia , Ali Jama ' Jangeli , Somali Foreign Minister , requested more African Union troops to assist other soldiers in the capital .
#Text=Both Kenya and Sudan backed Jangeli ; Djibouti answered the call and promised to send 450 soldiers soon .
#Text=" The situation in Somalia is very grim , it is very precarious .
